biocontainers.name: seacr
biocontainers.summary: Seacr is intended to call peaks and enriched regions from sparse cut&run or chromatin profiling data in which background is dominated by zeroes (i.e. regions with no read coverage). it requires r (https://www.r-project.org) and bedtools (https://bedtools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) to be available in your path, and it requires bedgraphs from paired-end sequencing as input, which can be generated from read pair bed files (i.e. bed coordinates reflecting the 5 and 3 termini of each read pair) using bedtools genomecov with the -bg flag, or alternatively from name-sorted paired-end bam files as described in preparing input bedgraph files below.
